translation.title: The Simile of the Stone Pillar

segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 9
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 9

segments.pli: 3. Sattāvāsavagga
segments.en: 3. Abodes of Sentient Beings

segments.pli: 26. Silāyūpasutta
segments.en: 26. The Simile of the Stone Pillar
So I have heard.

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ca sāriputto āyasmā ca candikāputto rājagahe viharanti veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.

segments.pli: Tatra kho āyasmā candikāputto bhikkhū āmantesi ():
segments.en: There Venerable Candikāputta addressed the mendicants,

segments.pli: “devadatto, āvuso, bhikkhūnaṃ evaṃ dhammaṃ deseti:
segments.en: “Reverends, Devadatta teaches the mendicants like this:

segments.pli: ‘yato kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno cetasā citaṃ hoti, tassetaṃ bhikkhuno kallaṃ veyyākaraṇāya—
segments.en: ‘When a mendicant’s mind is solidified by heart, it’s appropriate for them to say:

segments.pli: khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyāti pajānāmī’”ti.
segments.en: “I understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”’”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, āyasmā sāriputto āyasmantaṃ candikāputtaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he said this, Venerable Sāriputta said to him,

segments.pli: “na kho, āvuso candikāputta, devadatto bhikkhūnaṃ evaṃ dhammaṃ deseti:
segments.en: “Reverend Candikāputta, Devadatta does not teach the mendicants like that.

segments.pli: ‘yato kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno cetasā citaṃ hoti, tassetaṃ bhikkhuno kallaṃ veyyākaraṇāya—
khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyāti pajānāmī’ti.
Evañca kho, āvuso, candikāputta, devadatto bhikkhūnaṃ dhammaṃ deseti:
segments.en: He teaches like this:

segments.pli: ‘yato kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno cetasā cittaṃ suparicitaṃ hoti, tassetaṃ bhikkhuno kallaṃ veyyākaraṇāya—
segments.en: ‘When a mendicant’s mind is well consolidated by heart, it’s appropriate for them to say:

segments.pli: khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyāti pajānāmī’”ti.
segments.en: “I understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”’”

segments.pli: Dutiyampi kho āyasmā candikāputto bhikkhū āmantesi:
segments.en: For a second time …

segments.pli: “devadatto, āvuso, bhikkhūnaṃ evaṃ dhammaṃ deseti:
‘yato kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno cetasā citaṃ hoti, tassetaṃ bhikkhuno kallaṃ veyyākaraṇāya—
khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyāti pajānāmī’”ti.
Dutiyampi kho āyasmā sāriputto āyasmantaṃ candikāputtaṃ etadavoca:
“na kho, āvuso candikāputta, devadatto bhikkhūnaṃ evaṃ dhammaṃ deseti:
‘yato kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno cetasā citaṃ hoti, tassetaṃ bhikkhuno kallaṃ veyyākaraṇāya—
khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyāti pajānāmī’ti.
Evañca kho, āvuso candikāputta, devadatto bhikkhūnaṃ dhammaṃ deseti:
‘yato kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno cetasā cittaṃ suparicitaṃ hoti, tassetaṃ bhikkhuno kallaṃ veyyākaraṇāya—
khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyāti pajānāmī’”ti.
Tatiyampi kho āyasmā candikāputto bhikkhū āmantesi:
segments.en: And for a third time Venerable Candikāputta addressed the mendicants …

segments.pli: “devadatto, āvuso, bhikkhūnaṃ evaṃ dhammaṃ deseti:
‘yato kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno cetasā citaṃ hoti, tassetaṃ bhikkhuno kallaṃ veyyākaraṇāya—
khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyāti pajānāmī’”ti.
Tatiyampi kho āyasmā sāriputto āyasmantaṃ candikāputtaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: And for a third time, Sāriputta said to him,

segments.pli: “na kho, āvuso candikāputta, devadatto bhikkhūnaṃ evaṃ dhammaṃ deseti:
segments.en: “Reverend Candikāputta, Devadatta does not teach the mendicants like that.

segments.pli: ‘yato kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno cetasā citaṃ hoti, tassetaṃ bhikkhuno kallaṃ veyyākaraṇāya—
khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyāti pajānāmī’ti.
Evañca kho, āvuso candikāputta, devadatto bhikkhūnaṃ dhammaṃ deseti:
segments.en: He teaches like this:

segments.pli: ‘yato kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno cetasā cittaṃ suparicitaṃ hoti, tassetaṃ bhikkhuno kallaṃ veyyākaraṇāya—
segments.en: ‘When a mendicant’s mind is well consolidated by heart, it’s appropriate for them to say:

segments.pli: khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyāti pajānāmī’ti.
segments.en: “I understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”’

segments.pli: Kathañca, āvuso, bhikkhuno cetasā cittaṃ suparicitaṃ hoti?
segments.en: And how is a mendicant’s mind well consolidated by heart?

segments.pli: ‘Vītarāgaṃ me cittan’ti cetasā cittaṃ suparicitaṃ hoti;
segments.en: The mind is well consolidated by heart when they know: ‘My mind is without greed.’

segments.pli: ‘vītadosaṃ me cittan’ti cetasā cittaṃ suparicitaṃ hoti;
segments.en: … ‘My mind is without hate.’

segments.pli: ‘vītamohaṃ me cittan’ti cetasā cittaṃ suparicitaṃ hoti;
segments.en: … ‘My mind is without delusion.’

segments.pli: ‘asarāgadhammaṃ me cittan’ti cetasā cittaṃ suparicitaṃ hoti;
segments.en: … ‘My mind is not liable to become greedy.’

segments.pli: ‘asadosadhammaṃ me cittan’ti cetasā cittaṃ suparicitaṃ hoti;
segments.en: … ‘My mind is not liable to become hateful.’

segments.pli: ‘asamohadhammaṃ me cittan’ti cetasā cittaṃ suparicitaṃ hoti;
segments.en: … ‘My mind is not liable to become deluded.’

segments.pli: ‘anāvattidhammaṃ me cittaṃ kāmabhavāyā’ti cetasā cittaṃ suparicitaṃ hoti;
segments.en: … ‘My mind is not liable to return to rebirth in the sensual realm.’

segments.pli: ‘anāvattidhammaṃ me cittaṃ rūpabhavāyā’ti cetasā cittaṃ suparicitaṃ hoti;
segments.en: … ‘My mind is not liable to return to rebirth in the realm of luminous form.’

segments.pli: ‘anāvattidhammaṃ me cittaṃ arūpabhavāyā’ti cetasā cittaṃ suparicitaṃ hoti.
segments.en: … ‘My mind is not liable to return to rebirth in the formless realm.’

segments.pli: Evaṃ sammā vimuttacittassa kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno bhusā cepi cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā cakkhussa āpāthaṃ āgacchanti, nevassa cittaṃ pariyādiyanti;
segments.en: When a mendicant’s mind is rightly freed like this, even if compelling sights come into the range of vision they don’t occupy their mind.

segments.pli: amissīkatamevassa cittaṃ hoti ṭhitaṃ āneñjappattaṃ, vayaṃ cassānupassati.
segments.en: The mind remains unaffected. It is steady, imperturbable, observing disappearance.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, silāyūpo soḷasakukkuko.
segments.en: Suppose there was a stone pillar, sixteen feet long.

segments.pli: Tassassu aṭṭha kukkū heṭṭhā nemaṅgamā, aṭṭha kukkū upari nemassa.
segments.en: Eight feet were buried underground, and eight above ground.

segments.pli: Atha puratthimāya cepi disāya āgaccheyya bhusā vātavuṭṭhi, neva naṃ saṅkampeyya na sampavedheyya;
segments.en: And violent storms were to blow up out of the east, the west, the north, and the south.

segments.pli: atha pacchimāya …
atha uttarāya …
atha dakkhiṇāya cepi disāya āgaccheyya bhusā vātavuṭṭhi, neva naṃ saṅkampeyya na sampavedheyya.
segments.en: They couldn’t make it tremor and tremble and quake.

segments.pli: Taṃ kissa hetu?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: Gambhīrattā, āvuso, nemassa, sunikhātattā silāyūpassa.
segments.en: It’s because that boundary pillar is firmly embedded, with deep foundations.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, āvuso, sammā vimuttacittassa bhikkhuno bhusā cepi cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā cakkhussa āpāthaṃ āgacchanti, nevassa cittaṃ pariyādiyanti;
segments.en: In the same way, when a mendicant’s mind is rightly freed like this, even if compelling sights come into the range of vision they don’t occupy their mind.

segments.pli: amissīkatamevassa cittaṃ hoti ṭhitaṃ āneñjappattaṃ, vayaṃ cassānupassati.
segments.en: The mind remains unaffected. It is steady, imperturbable, observing disappearance.

segments.pli: Bhusā cepi sotaviññeyyā saddā …
segments.en: If even compelling sounds …

segments.pli: ghānaviññeyyā gandhā …
segments.en: smells …

segments.pli: jivhāviññeyyā rasā …
segments.en: tastes …

segments.pli: kāyaviññeyyā phoṭṭhabbā …
segments.en: touches …

segments.pli: manoviññeyyā dhammā manassa āpāthaṃ āgacchanti, nevassa cittaṃ pariyādiyanti;
segments.en: and thoughts come into the range of the mind they don’t occupy the mind.

segments.pli: amissīkatamevassa cittaṃ hoti ṭhitaṃ āneñjappattaṃ, vayaṃ cassānupassatī”ti.
segments.en: The mind remains unaffected. It is steady, imperturbable, observing disappearance.”

segments.pli: Chaṭṭhaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: Venerables Candikāputta and Sāriputta differ in their interpretation of a teaching proposed by the notorious schismatic Devadatta.
